NOTICE OF PUBLIC SALE To satisfy the owner's privilege, PS Retail Sales, LLC will sell at public sale on June 24, 2025, the personal property in the below-listed units, which may include but are not limited to: household and personal items, office and other equipment. The public sale of these items will begin at 08:00 AM and continue until all units are sold. The lien sale is to be held at the online auction website, www.storagetreasures.com, where indicated. For online lien sales, bids will be accepted until 2 hours after the time of the sale specified. Rockwall Housing Authority Notice of Public Meeting The Rockwall Housing Authority will hold a public meeting on Thursday, June 19, 2025, at 10:00 a.m. at 100 Lake Meadows Drive, Rockwall, TX to receive public comments regarding the Five-Year Plan for the Housing Authority. All related documents are available for public review at the Housing Authority office located at 100 Lake Meadows Drive, Monday through Thursday, between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. The Five-Year Plan is also available for viewing on our website. Members of the public are encouraged to attend and provide feedback. REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS CITY OF ROYSE CITY, TEXAS PROCUREMENT OF YOUTH&ADULT, BASEBALL&SOFTBALL LEAGUE SERVICES Sealed proposals will be received in the Finance Office of the City of Royse City, 100 W. Main Street, Royse City, Texas 75189 until 2:00 p.m., June 24, 2025 and then publicly opened and proposers name read for furnishing of all services to the City of Royse City. The Owner intends to provide a notice of award of contract within sixty (60) days of the proposal due date. Proposals without all required documents and information will be rejected. Proposals shall be marked "SEALED PROPOSAL - Proposal for youth and adult baseball and softball league services" on the outside of the envelope. For more information or to obtain a pdf of the bid proposal documents, visit the City of Royse City website at www.roysecity.com under Bid Opportunities. The City reserves the right to reject any or all proposals and to waive any informality in the proposals received. In case of ambiguity or lack of clearness in stating prices in the proposals, the City reserves the right to consider the most advantageous construction thereof, or to reject the bid. Unreasonable or unbalanced unit prices will be considered sufficient cause of rejection of bids. CITY OF MCLENDON-CHISHOLM NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING Notice is hereby given that the Planning and Zoning Commission of the City of McLendon-Chisholm, Texas will hold a public hearing for a Specific Use Permit for a "Private School" at a meeting that begins at 6:30 PM on Tuesday, June 17, 2025 at 1371 West FM 550, McLendon-Chisholm, Texas 75032. Further notice is given that a second public hearing is scheduled where the request and the recommendation of the Planning and Zoning Commission will be considered by the McLendon-Chisholm City Council at a meeting that begins at 6:30 p.m. on Tuesday, June 24, 2025, at 1371 West FM 550, McLendon-Chisholm, Texas 75032. The Planning and Zoning Commission and City Council will conduct public hearings and consider the proposed Specific Use Permit for a "Private School" as outlined in the Zoning Ordinance. This property is located at 1271 Hwy 205, McLendon-Chisholm, Texas 75032. RCAD property ID # 11424. Citizens are invited to attend and participate in these public hearings, and the Planning and Zoning Commission and City Council may continue a public hearing from one meeting to another. Additional information regarding this item may be viewed at www.mclendon-chisholm.com or obtained by calling (972) 524-2077. NOTICE OF FIRM REVISION CITY OF ROYSE CITY The Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM) for a community depicts the Special Flood Hazard Area (SFHA), the area which has been determined to be subject to a 1% (100-year) or greater chance of flooding in any given year. The floodway is the portion of the floodplain that includes the channel of a river or other watercourse and the adjacent land area that must be reserved in order to discharge the 1% annual chance (base) flood without cumulatively increasing the water-surface elevation by more than a designated height. The FIRM is used to help the community with floodplain management. TNP, Inc. is applying for a Letter of Map Revision (LOMR) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (DHS-FEMA) on behalf of Royse City Community Development Corporation to revise FIRM 48397C0055L, panel 55 for the City of Royse City, Texas along Pond Branch. Royse City Community Development Corporation is proposing to revise the floodplain based on updated topography. The City of Royse City's Development Services Department, in accordance with National Flood Insurance Program regulation at 44 CFR Â§65.7(b)(1), hereby gives notice of the city's intent to revise the 1-percent-annual-chance floodway, generally located between Erby Campbell Boulevard and South Elm Street. Specifically, the floodway shall be revised from a point downstream of F.M. 548 to a point just downstream of Missouri-Kansas-Texas Railroad. The LOMR will also result in widening and narrowing of the 1-percent-annual-chance floodplain and both increases and decreases in the 1% annual chance (base) water-surface elevations for a portion of Pond Branch. This letter is to inform you of the proposed revision that may affect flood elevations on your property at . Maps and detailed analysis of the proposed flood hazard revisions can be reviewed at the Development Services Department at 141 W. Main Street Royse City, 75189. If you have any questions or concerns about the proposed project or its effect on your property, you may contact Royse City Development Services at 972-542-4833. PUBLIC HEARING NOTICE ROYSE CITY COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RCCDC) NOTICE OF INTENT TO PROVIDE INCENTIVE PAYMENT For the public purpose of promoting economic development and diversity, increasing employment, reducing unemployment, expanding commerce, and stimulating business and commerce activities in the State of Texas, Rockwall County, theÂ City Council of the City of Royse City, and the RCCDC Board have approved an incentive grant, not to exceed $16,500 to HXH STUDIOS to help offset the costs of EXTERIOR RENOVATIONS AND A PARKING LOT EXPANSION AT THEIR PLACE OF BUSINESS located at 413 I-30, Royse City, TX. HXH STUDIOS will make a capital investment of at least $26,150 to pave the way for future expansion and create or retain up to 9 jobs. The approved grant is a reimbursement grant that will be paid after the renovation is completed and is contingent upon an executed Performance Agreement with the RCCDC. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY Proposed Flood Hazard Determinations for the City of Fate, Rockwall County, Texas, Case No. 24-06-1645P. The Department of Homeland Security's Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) solicits technical information or comments on proposed flood hazard determinations for the Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM), and where applicable, the Flood Insurance Study (FIS) report for your community. These flood hazard determinations may include the addition or modification of Base Flood Elevations, base flood depths, Special Flood Hazard Area boundaries or zone designations, or the regulatory floodway. The FIRM and, if applicable, the FIS report have been revised to reflect these flood hazard determinations through issuance of a Letter of Map Revision (LOMR), in accordance with Title 44, Part 65 of the Code of Federal Regulations. These determinations are the basis for the floodplain management measures that your community is required to adopt or show evidence of having in effect to qualify or remain qualified for participation in the National Flood Insurance Program. For more information on the proposed flood hazard determinations and information on the statutory 90-day period provided for appeals, please visit FEMA?s website at https://www.floodmaps.fema.gov/fhm/BFE_Status/bfe_main.asp , or call the FEMA Mapping and Insurance eXchange (FMIX) toll free at 1-877-FEMA MAP (1-877-336-2627). The FIRM and, if applicable, the FIS report have been revised to reflect these flood hazard determinations through issuance of a Letter of Map Revision (LOMR), in accordance with Title 44, Part 65 of the Code of Federal Regulations. These determinations are the basis for the floodplain management measures that your community is required to adopt or show evidence of having in effect to qualify or remain qualified for participation in the National Flood Insurance Program. For more information on the proposed flood hazard determinations and information on the statutory 90-day period provided for appeals, please visit FEMA?s website at https://www.floodmaps.fema.gov/fhm/BFE_Status/bfe_main.asp , or call the FEMA Mapping and Insurance eXchange (FMIX) toll free at 1-877-FEMA MAP (1-877-336-2627).
